page.title: 09Population
page.content: Since the Second World War the population of this area has increased considerably so that original local families are in a minority.Taking a sample survey of 175 families,about 43% of the members were born locally,though many of these are still children.By far the greatest number of newer inhabitants have come from the Greater London area or the counties surrounding Bucks.,but most counties of England are represented.Other parts of the UK are included too,as are countries stretching from New Zealand in the East through India,Africa and Europe to Canada in the West. Family sizes show that 58% of our sample have four members and nearly 26% have five,with 10% of six or more.The majority of families in the whole area have children of school age,though the number of school pupils is declining.
